###8.2: 1. Let X be a continuous random variable with mean ?? = 10 and variance ??^2 = 100/3. Using Chebyshev's Inequality, find an upper bound for the following probabilities.

(a) P(|X ??? 10| ??? 2).


```{r}
VarX <- 100/3
(sigma <- sqrt(VarX))
epsilon <- 2
(k <- epsilon/sigma)
(chebyshev <- pmin(1/k^2, 1))
```



(b) P(|X ??? 10| ??? 5).
```{r}
VarX <- 100/3
(sigma <- sqrt(VarX))
epsilon <- 5
(k <- epsilon/sigma)
(chebyshev <- 1/k^2)
```

(c) P(|X ??? 10| ??? 9).
